method.name: Generalized Condensed Nearest Neighbor

reference.ref: F. Chang, C.-C. Lin, C.-J. Lu. Adaptive Prototype Learning Algorithms: Theoretical and Experimental Studies. Journal of Machine Learning Research 7 (2006) 2125-2148.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Instance Selection. Incremental.
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: This algorithm is a generalization of the CNN rule. The parameter Rho indicates the threshold for considering a subset as consistent and it depends on the minimun distance among all the heterogeneous samples. Thus, a value of Rho equal to 0 implies that the algorithm behaves equal to CNN.

parameterSpec.param: Rho: Real value. Threshold of absorbence propoerty.

Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
